item.title: 225 – Seagulls
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Seagulls I’m pinned down by seagulls and the weight of gold in their feathers I flap my arms to soar and find myself in the sand The surf in my ears Ghostly feet glimmer at the tide line then vanish … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Seagulls

I’m pinned down by seagulls
and the weight of gold
in their feathers

I flap my arms
to soar and find myself
in the sand

The surf in my ears

Ghostly feet glimmer
at the tide line then vanish
in a breaking breath

This is a dream I’ll have again

once for each grain of sand
once for each fallen feather

item.title: 224 – Storm
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Storm Camped out on the porch waiting on a threatened thunderstorm that won’t show. Just some speckled rain turning broke-neck grass and briquets the scent of wet pavement. Fake-out. Look to miss the empty sucking breath between the streaking sheet … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Storm

Camped out on the porch waiting
on a threatened thunderstorm
that won’t show.

Just some speckled rain turning
broke-neck grass and briquets
the scent of wet pavement.

Fake-out.

Look to miss the empty sucking breath
between the streaking sheet and clap.

Flag’s a dead blossom. Dog’s legs
splay out, twitching. Neighbor’s gaggle
swished indoors an hour ago.

Bees don’t mind the calm, laced and floating.

Settle in and see what comes.

Study at the mangled stump
some fool took a saw to
in a fit of quick gumption.

Ruled over and subdued it,
hacked down its dying crown
to an awkward stump.

Good for nothing now but a birdhouse, maybe,
a lashing for a forgotten, knotted hammock.

Its single cut-eye wallows, weeping
sap, staring out at nothing;
it’s bigger, badder all-yell mouth–

a badly angled cut that took its healthiest limb–
calls out at all comers, all hours.
It’s waiting, too for a storm

that never comes. Think silver iodide,
Zeus on a bender. Think sucker punch
of summer, crinkling heat without a breath

of air to tickle at. Caught down in the belly,
lower than. Scritch the dog behind her ears,
suck on a dusty stone.

See what comes yet of the sky and all its purple swagger.

item.title: 223 – O Captain! My Captain!
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: O Captain! My Captain! God bless you for showing us all how to tear up the rules of poetry.
item.content:encoded:
O Captain! My Captain!

God bless you
for showing us all
how to tear up the rules
of poetry.

item.title: 222 – Sabbath
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: 221 – Sabbath Not far off the drums of the LORD are beating. The faithful pass to crowd the house They built for bending low. & it is good. But I find myself tired today Of the drums and of … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
221 – Sabbath

Not far off the drums of the LORD are beating.
The faithful pass to crowd the house
They built for bending low.

& it is good.
But I find myself tired today
Of the drums and of the crowds.

And so I sit on this old stoop
With robins & an errant jay.

The sun climb the steps
Of this altar where shadows fall
As supplicants.

I too lay my head down, to a song
I did not fashion, in a light
I cannot know the strains of.

I hear the drums and I am glad
in the City of the Most High there is a river
whose stones sing a simpler song.

The robin and the jay make home here;
The shadows pool deep next to the light.
Errant but not alone in my wandering.

item.title: 221 – August & the Belly
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: August & the Belly I’ll cup a hand of lavendar & surprise you with its scent in my empty hand what’s left of August & the belly of every long hot summer day will break over you in purple lingering
item.content:encoded:
August & the Belly

I’ll cup a hand of lavendar
& surprise you with its scent
in my empty hand

what’s left of August & the belly
of every long hot summer day
will break over you

in purple lingering

item.title: 220 – Bread
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Bread Who among you gives a stone or snake when asked for bread? How sharply we see the stone, the snake, curled in the hand. How quick we are to break the bread held out. Open your mouths in praise … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Bread

Who among you gives
a stone or snake
when asked for bread?

How sharply we see
the stone, the snake,
curled in the hand.

How quick we are
to break
the bread held out.

Open your mouths
in praise and wailing.
Open your mouths and be fed.

item.title: 219 – Fishing
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Fishing I’ve run the faucet too long. I’m dry tonight. I’ll dream up a river pulsing with words like quicksilver trout lurking beneath the surface and wake with a net full to breaking.
item.content:encoded:
Fishing

I’ve run the faucet too long.
I’m dry tonight. I’ll dream up
a river pulsing with words
like quicksilver trout lurking
beneath the surface and wake
with a net full to breaking.

item.title: 218 – Greg Luganis
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Greg Luganis He jumped, too tucked & spun into a ball of thought his body made of knees & hands until it broke apart I watched wide-eyed the replay over & over my small boy body tucked against the thought … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Greg Luganis

He jumped, too
tucked & spun
into a ball
of thought
his body made
of knees & hands
until it broke apart

I watched wide-eyed
the replay over
& over
my small boy body
tucked against
the thought
of breaking

item.title: 216 – Among the Trees
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: I come to sit awhile among the trees. I am still and in my stillness see I am alive to what I miss: movement, color, light and sound fallen deathly quiet at my step. I am the passing shadow that … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
I come to sit awhile among the trees.
I am still and in my stillness see
I am alive to what I miss: movement,
color, light and sound
fallen deathly quiet at my step.

I am the passing shadow that means fear.
I sit in it and what fears me comes
alive. A broken branch, a yellow eye, warning call
turned to morning song. Stillness is the gift
that breaks itself.

I sit in what I fear among the trees,
the moving shades, the smell of apple rot
and understory plagued by gentle breeze.
Stillness is a thing of movement, shifting
with the breath, rising in the failing light.

Among the trees I came to sit and be awhile.
To shift and sway, a poplar rooted
less firmly in the bark, less afraid
of dappled shadow and unseen many,
at home, at peace, amid the growing dark.

item.title: 217 – Acquaintance
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Acquaintance I didn’t see you leave the earth or your quick return to it. I knew you only in the shouting seconds in which you thought your last. What did you think? When I turned to see you, you were  … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Acquaintance

I didn’t see you
leave the earth
or your quick return
to it.

I knew you only
in the shouting seconds
in which you thought
your last. What did you think?

When I turned to see
you, you were  gone. Fallen
to shadow and foliage.
Swallowed up.

We never met
or maybe we did
on the street
in passing

as is common
and so uneventful
as not to matter
or worth noticing.

I can’t help
but know you now
or what you’ve left
me holding.
